newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end up after downside holds.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end up after downside holds.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended slightly higher in relatively thin trade on Thursday after efforts to test the downside failed, dealers said.
"People are still willing to buy. The correction has been quite healthy after the recent rise," a trader with a Japanese futures house said.
After opening sharply lower following Wall Street's 140-point loss overnight, the lead Nikkei 225 June contract recovered to close 45 points higher at 20,105. Market turnover was 12,315 lots.
"I think people are trying to hold the market above 20,000 ahead of tomorrow SQ (special quotation for the options settlement)," the trader said.
He said the market could undergo a further correction after the settlement on Friday, but was likely to be supported around the 19,800 level.
"I think the market will consolidate around here for a while. The topside should be capped at 20,300," he said.
The May MSCI Taiwan index contract ended at 344.5 against its opening 348.4 on volume of 1,207 lots.
